content: The `Math` class provides methods to perform various math calculations. These methods include calculating the square root, absolute value, and hypothesis, and many other operations.
fields: [{"name":"PI","type":"static double","description":"the `double` value representing pi, the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter"}]
name: Math

methods.name: abs
methods.parameters: [{"name":"a","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the value whose absolute value is to be determined"}]

methods.name: abs
methods.content: Returns the absolute value of an `int` value.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"a","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the value whose absolute value is to be determined"}]

methods.name: sqrt
methods.content: Returns the square root of `a`. The return value will always be a positive and correctly rounded number.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"a","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the value to obtain the square root"}]

methods.name: random
methods.content: Returns a random value that is greater than or equal to `0.0` and less than `1.0`.

methods.name: pow
methods.content: Returns the first argument raised to the power of the second argument.
methods.syntax: `public static double pow(double a, double b)`
